conclusion: When the two cars meet in the cluttered centre, the head-on impact transfers more forward momentum to the lighter pink car (A) than to the heavier green car (B).

A is deflected to the upper-right part of the mat, where there are no further obstacles, so it keeps rolling until its spring power is exhausted; it finally comes to rest in the clear, upper-right corner.
B, after losing some speed in the collision, is turned slightly to the left.
Almost immediately B bumps the red and purple blocks, which absorb what is left of its kinetic energy, so it stops near those blocks on the left side of the mat.
Car A (pink) comes to rest in the upper-right corner of the green cloth.
Car B (green) stops at the left-centre of the cloth, beside the red and purple cubes.
